org.pentaho.pat.server.services
Interface SessionService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
All Known Implementing Classes:
SessionServiceImpl
public interface SessionService
extends Service

Manages the operations on the GUI and persists it's current selections.

Author:
Luc Boudreau

Method Detail

validateSession

void validateSession(java.lang.String userId,
                     java.lang.String sessionId)
                     throws java.lang.SecurityException
Validates that a user session id is valid.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the session
sessionId - The session unique id
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - If either the userId or the sessionId are invalid.

validateUser

void validateUser(java.lang.String userId)
                  throws java.lang.SecurityException
Validates that this userId exists.

Parameters:
userId - The user unique id to validate.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - If this user doesn't exist.

createNewSession

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.lang.String createNewSession(java.lang.String userId)
Creates a new session space.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the session to create.
Returns:
The session unique ID.

releaseSession

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void releaseSession(java.lang.String userId,
                            java.lang.String sessionId)
Closes and deletes a session.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the session to close.
sessionId - The session id we want to close.

getSession

@Secured(value="ROLE_ADMIN")
Session getSession(java.lang.String userId,
                           java.lang.String sessionId)
Accesses a session object directly.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the required session.
sessionId - The id of the session we want.
Returns:
The session object, null if none found.

saveUserSessionVariable

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void saveUserSessionVariable(java.lang.String userId,
                                     java.lang.String sessionId,
                                     java.lang.String key,
                                     java.lang.Object value)
Stores an object in the user session space for later use.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the session into which we want to store.
sessionId - The id of the session into which to store the variable.
key - The key under which to store the variable.
value - The object to store into the session space.

getUserSessionVariable

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.lang.Object getUserSessionVariable(java.lang.String userId,
                                                java.lang.String sessionId,
                                                java.lang.String key)
Retreives a session variable object.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the session.
sessionId - The session od from which we want a variable retreived.
key - The key under which the variable is stored.
Returns:
The stored object, null if none found.

deleteUserSessionVariable

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void deleteUserSessionVariable(java.lang.String userId,
                                       java.lang.String sessionId,
                                       java.lang.String key)
Removes a session variable object from the session space.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the session.
sessionId - The id of the session that contains the variable.
key - The key under which the variable is stored.

createConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void createConnection(java.lang.String userId,
                              java.lang.String sessionId,
                              java.lang.String driverName,
                              java.lang.String connectStr,
                              java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password)
                      throws org.olap4j.OlapException
Establishes a connection according to the supplied parameters.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the connection to establish.
sessionId - The session id under which the connection will be stored.
driverName - The Olap4j driver to use.
connectStr - The URL to send to the Olap4j driver.
username - The connection username to connect.
password - The username's password.
Throws:
org.olap4j.OlapException - If the connection fails.

getConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
org.olap4j.OlapConnection getConnection(java.lang.String userId,
                                                java.lang.String sessionId)

releaseConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void releaseConnection(java.lang.String userId,
                               java.lang.String sessionId)
Closes a connection.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the connection.
sessionId - The session id that contains the connection

getSavedConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
@Transactional(readOnly=true)
SavedConnection getSavedConnection(java.lang.String userId,
                                                         java.lang.String connectionName)
Retreives a saved connection.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the connection.
connectionName - The name of the connection.
Returns:
The SavedConnection object, null if not found.

getSavedConnections

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
@Transactional(readOnly=true)
java.util.List<SavedConnection> getSavedConnections(java.lang.String userId)
Returns a list of saved connections associated to a user.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the connections we want the names of.
Returns:
A list of connection names, null if the user doesn't exist.

saveConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
@Transactional(readOnly=false)
void saveConnection(java.lang.String userId,
                                          SavedConnection connection)
Saves a connection in a user account.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the connection. The saved connection will be associated to his account.
connection - The connection to save.

deleteSavedConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
@Transactional(readOnly=false)
void deleteSavedConnection(java.lang.String userId,
                                                 java.lang.String connectionName)
Deletes a saved connection from a user account.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the connection to delete.
connectionName - The name of the connection to delete.

createNewQuery

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.lang.String createNewQuery(java.lang.String userId,
                                        java.lang.String sessionId)
                                throws org.olap4j.OlapException
Creates a new query for a given session.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the query to create.
sessionId - The session id into which we want to create a new query.
Returns:
A unique query identification number.
Throws:
org.olap4j.OlapException - If creating the query fails.

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
org.olap4j.query.Query getQuery(java.lang.String userId,
                                        java.lang.String sessionId,
                                        java.lang.String queryId)

getQueries

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.util.List<java.lang.String> getQueries(java.lang.String userId,
                                                    java.lang.String sessionId)
Returns a list of the currently created queries inside a given session.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the session and queries.
sessionId - The unique id of the session for which we want the current opened queries.
Returns:
A list of query names.

releaseQuery

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void releaseQuery(java.lang.String userId,
                          java.lang.String sessionId,
                          java.lang.String queryId)
Releases and closes a query inside a given session.

Parameters:
userId - The owner of the query.
sessionId - The unique session id for which we want to close and delete a query.
queryId - The unique id of the query to close and release.
